column5: Thanks John, I'll be there the last week of Aug.
Ok,I got the wrong lake,it's been awhile since I've been lost on a lake lol.
It's possible to get lost on eagle

I was up there end of may beginning of June. Pat hasn't sold it yet and I gathered that there is now a 20 percent surcharge for foreign buyers so that MAY slow sales down. Great camp. Excellent fishing.
Looking for information on Cedar Point Lodge on Eagle lake, has anyone been there this year?
Hit up prov1800 he will give you the low down on cedar,he's the local pro on cedar.

The camp is for sale and I’m booked with them the last week of August, tried to access their website but it’s down. Not sure if it sold just curious if anyones been there this year, I’ll have to give them a call.
Been for sale a while but havnt heard of it being sold yet.Freind of mine guides there. I'll get in touch and see what's happening
Buddy got back to me.Its not sold.tried web site and its Down.Best to call Pat at camp for info.When you headed there

I got back a week ago from Cedar Point Lodge. It was my first visit. Went with a friend that hooked up with a group that has been going there for 20+ years. I've stayed all over NW Ontario and fished most of the big lakes. This was the nicest and cleanest cabin I have ever been to. Air conditioning in a cabin? Yep! One day it was like 93 out. The AC and a cold beer were awesome when we came back in. They clean your fish for you too. I've eaten quite a bit when up there and here back home. Not a single bone!!! Boats were great too. Lots of great fishing spots close by. The fishing was great. Be on a good spot, wait for the feeding window, and get ready for a fish on almost every cast. I had a few beers with Pat. Great guy. Yes the place is for sale and it was not sold as of a week ago. I can tell you for sure that they aren't slacking off. Like I said, great cabins, great boats, great service, and a good vibe. Enjoy your stay!!!
